description.raw:
Allow plugins to anchor to other previously loaded plugins, instead of only to the window.

Although QML supports having different anchors to different targets, I chose to support all anchors sharing the same target so it's easier to manage on our side. Please comment below if you'd like more details, but it's basically related to keeping track of plugin's parents.

The `scene3d.config` example has been changed so that the control and stats plugins are anchored to the scene, not to the window. This doesn't make a visual difference right now, but it will once we have multiple docked plugins next to the scene.

This is part of branch `gz11_split`, which I'm breaking into smaller changes while I implement the remaining features.

The scene3d.config example has been changed so that the control and stats plugins are anchored to the scene, not to the window. This doesn't make a visual difference right now, but it will once we have multiple docked plugins next to the scene.

This is part of branch gz11_split, which I'm breaking into smaller changes while I implement the remaining features.

title.raw: [gz11] Extend anchor logic so plugins can anchor to each other
